function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of consideration for the density and spatial distribution of Points of Interest (POIs) in pandemic-related research","Impact":"Higher infection rates in neighborhoods with more populated POIs","Mitigation":"Include POIs' visiting data into pandemic models and consider the diversity, density, and spatial distribution of POIs in urban areas","Technologies":"Spatial analysis tools, pandemic modeling software","People":"Researchers, urban planners, public health officials","Owner":"Research institutions, city planning departments"},{"Description":"Spatial disadvantages and inequality leading to disproportionate pandemic vulnerabilities","Impact":"Systematically disproportionate COVID-19 hospitalizations and deaths in different urban areas","Mitigation":"Deeper understanding of spatial distribution of social inequalities and their impact on public health, addressing income inequality and spatial segregation","Technologies":"Urban data sets, spatial analysis tools, public health indicators","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, social equity advocates","Owner":"City planning departments, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Lack of consideration for health equity in urban design and planning practice","Impact":"Inequitable distribution of public health resources and pandemic vulnerabilities","Mitigation":"Deeper understanding of spatial distribution of social inequalities and their impact on public health, incorporation of health equity principles into urban design and planning","Technologies":"Urban data sets, spatial analysis tools, public health indicators","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, social equity advocates","Owner":"City planning departments, public health organizations"}]}
